src:
Pakistanec z ukradenim avtom privozil vse do Slovenije
Sirec brez vozniškega dovoljenja je povzročil nesrečo.
06 Nov 2019, 09:35 by T. V.
SVIŠČAKI, SPODNJE ŠKOFIJE – V četrtek popoldne so policisti na cesti za Sviščake ustavili forda kugo, ki ga je vozil 31-letni državljan Pakistana. Pri preverjanju v Italiji so slovenski policisti ugotovili, da je vozilo prijavljeno kot ukradeno v Milanu. Pakistanec je bil s kazensko ovadbo priveden k preiskovalnemu sodniku, ta pa je zanj odredil pripor.V nedeljo ob 9.20 je policijo poklical domačin in povedal, da po Spodnjih Škofijah hodi mlajši moški in si nekaj ogleduje. Policisti so izsledili 21-letnega državljana Sirije z urejenim statusom v Nemčiji. Ugotovili so, da je pred tem imel prometno nesrečo. Pri sebi je imel ključe vozila, nima pa vozniškega dovoljenja. Vozilo so mu zasegli, zoper voznika pa bo podan obdolžilni predlog za vožnjo brez vozniškega dovoljenja in za pobeg s kraja prometne nesreče.Policisti so na območju PU Koper od srede, 30. oktobra, od 6. ure do ponedeljka, 4. novembra, do 6. ure obravnavali več ilegalnih prehodov. Po ročnih evidencah (uradni dokumenti niso še zaključeni, saj postopki še potekajo) je bilo obravnavano približno 150 oseb, ki so nedovoljeno prestopile državno mejo med Hrvaško in Slovenijo. Večji del teh je obravnavala PP Ilirska Bistrica, so sporočili iz PU Koper.
text:
A Pakistani man with a stolen car drove all the way to Slovenia
An orphan without a driver's license caused the accident.
06 Nov 2019, 09:35 by T.V.
SWITCHES, LOWER dioceses - Police stopped a Ford plague on Thursday afternoon, driven by a 31-year-old Pakistani citizen. During a check in Italy, Slovenian police found that the vehicle had been reported stolen in Milan. The Pakistani man was brought to a magistrate with a criminal complaint, who ordered him detained. On Sunday, at 9.20, police called a local man and told him that a younger man was walking through Lower Diocese and was looking at something. Police officers tracked down a 21-year-old Syrian citizen with an orderly status in Germany. They found out he had a car accident before. He had the vehicle keys with him, but did not have a driver's license. The vehicle was seized and a driver will be charged with driving without a driver's license and fleeing the scene of a car accident. Police officers are in the Koper Police Station from Wednesday, October 30, from 6am to Monday, November 4, until 6am dealt with several illegal crossings. According to manual records (official documents have not yet been finalized, as the proceedings are still pending), approximately 150 persons were considered to have crossed the state border between Croatia and Slovenia. Most of these were addressed by the Ilirska Bistrica Nature Park, according to the Koper Police Directorate.
